definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: They will expect a career growth and a magnificent actualization of a number of projects.
sentences.chinese: 他们会预期到职业的成长，一些项目会漂亮的完成。

sentences.english: Made of natural coconut, keep your lovely pets growing with healthy and fun.
sentences.chinese: 纯天然椰壳制成，保证爱宠健康快乐成长。

sentences.english: A powerful personal growth tool is the 30-day trial.
sentences.chinese: 有一种个人成长的有效工具，叫做“30天试验”。

sentences.english: Moral and em o tional education is rather essential in teenagers' moral development.
sentences.chinese: 道德情感教育对青少年道德成长具有重要作用。

sentences.english: Civilized etiquette of our study is a foundation, is the healthy growth of our arms.
sentences.chinese: 文明礼仪是我们学习的根基，是我们健康成长的臂膀。

sentences.english: From the above-mentioned story we can see that Mencius mother realized the importance of environment for children's development.
sentences.chinese: 由此可见，孟母深知环境对孩子成长的影响。

sentences.english: This fits with their extremely slow growth and reproduction rates.
sentences.chinese: 这一点与他们极低的成长速度和繁殖率相吻合。

sentences.english: Like those tadpoles, we grew legs and hopped off into the world.
sentences.chinese: 像那些蝌蚪一样，我们也逐渐成长，并跃进了世界。

sentences.english: If children live with jealousy, they learn what envy is.
sentences.chinese: 在嫉妒中成长的孩子，学会钩心斗角。

sentences.english: Yet coal mines are as much a part of China's civilization as paddy fields.
sentences.chinese: 然而，煤矿就像是供养中国文明成长的稻田。

sentences.english: Coeducation gives kids the opportunity of growing in an atmosphere of diversity.
sentences.chinese: 男女同校为孩子提供了一种丰富多彩的成长环境。

sentences.english: Homer Software continues its rapid growth and is acquired for $100m.
sentences.chinese: 荷马软件保持高速成长，并以1亿美元的价格被收购。

sentences.english: How have you grown this year?
It can promote teacher's specialized knowledge through the development of music appreciation class.
sentences.chinese: 通过开发音乐欣赏课程促进了教师的专业成长。

sentences.english: Taiwans' economic growth has dropped to its slowest rate in 26 years.
sentences.chinese: 台湾的经济成长率创下二十六年来的新低点。

sentences.english: Now suppose there are 100 igloos arranged in a rectangular grid.
sentences.chinese: 现在，假设有100座冰屋排成长方格形状。

definition: lit. to break through a cocoon and turn into a butterfly (idiom)/fig. to emerge strong after a period of struggle/to get to a better place after going through difficult period
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
